full_summary:
# 6.09-6.7m Aluminum Landing Craft Tender Announcement

## Request for Proposal Details

- **Tender Reference Number**: PW-MC-048-29099
- **Amendment Number**: Amendment 002
- **Solicitation Number**: F7044-221218/A
- **Publication Date**: June 20, 2023
- **Tender Closing Date**: July 26, 2023, 2:00 p.m. ET
- **Amendment Date**: July 17, 2023

### Trade Agreement and Procurement Method

This tender is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA). The procurement method is competitive, selective tendering.

### Requirement Details

Public Works and Government Services Canada, on behalf of the Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada, is seeking the construction and delivery of eight 6.09-6.7m aluminum landing craft with wheelhouse and trailer for transport and delivery to the Ontario region within 14 months after contract award. There is an option for three additional vessels.

### Eligibility and Tendering Process

Only suppliers holding an existing Small Boat Supply Arrangement (SA Holders) are eligible to compete for this requirement. The solicitation documents will be emailed directly to the eligible SA Holders. New suppliers can participate by qualifying for a SA, as outlined in the RFSA # E60MC-190001.

### Tender Submission Details

Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada (English or French). The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.

### Contact Information

For more information, please contact:

Mikaela Renaud
Public Works and Government Services Canada
11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage
Gatineau, Quebec K1A 0S5
Phone: (343) 597-9852
Email: [Mikaela.Renaud@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:Mikaela.Renaud@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)

### Important Dates

- **Publication Date**: June 20, 2023
- **Tender Closing Date**: July 26, 2023, 2:00 p.m. ET
- **Delivery Date**: 14 months after contract award

### Other Information

This requirement is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) and has no security association. The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement
